tasks.title: Review and polish Eclair UI for launch
tasks.description: Check for rough edges, verify interactions, ensure visual consistency
tasks.details:
## Deliverable: Eclair UI polished and launch-ready

### Context
PRD Phase 9 (docs/project/PRD/active/PRD-phase-9-launch.md), Milestone 7, Deliverables D7.1-D7.4.

Review Eclair visualizer for any rough edges, broken interactions, or visual inconsistencies before launch.

### Key Decisions and Principles
- No obvious bugs or broken features
- Follows brand guidelines
- Works on common screen sizes

### Delivers
Eclair ready for public use.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Given demo URL pre-fill When Load clicked Then demo loads correctly
- Given visualization When viewed Then no layout issues or broken styling
- Given browser console When app used Then no errors logged
- Given domain filtering When used Then filters work correctly
- Given node selection When clicked Then selection highlights correctly
- Given zoom/pan When used Then navigation works smoothly
- Given brand guidelines When compared Then colors and typography match
- Given different screen sizes When tested Then layout adapts reasonably

### Dependencies
- Task 57 (demo URL pre-fill configured)

### Related Code
- apps/eclair/src/
- docs/brand/ — brand guidelines for comparison

### Verification
- nx serve eclair
- Test all interactions manually
- Check browser console for errors
- Compare against brand guidelines
- Test on different viewport sizes

tasks.title: Add --signature flags to CLI enrich command
tasks.description: Add --parameter and --return-type flags to enrich command for DomainOp components
tasks.details:
## Deliverable: CLI enrich command supports method signatures

### Context
During extraction workflow testing, we found that the schema supports `signature` on DomainOp components, the builder supports it, and the UI displays it—but the CLI `enrich` command has no flags to add signatures.

Schema definition (`packages/riviere-schema/src/schema.ts:16-19`):
```typescript
export interface OperationSignature {
  parameters?: OperationParameter[]
  returnType?: string
}
```

Builder already supports it (`packages/riviere-builder/src/builder.ts:386`).

### Key Decisions and Principles
- Parameter format: `--parameter "name:type"` or `--parameter "name:type:description"`
- Return type format: `--return-type <type>`
- Flags are repeatable (like existing `--reads`, `--validates`, etc.)
- Follow existing patterns in enrich.ts for parsing and validation

### Delivers
Ability to add method signatures when enriching DomainOp components via CLI.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Given DomainOp, When `--parameter "orderId:string"`, Then signature.parameters includes `{name: "orderId", type: "string"}`
- Given DomainOp, When `--parameter "orderId:string:The order ID"`, Then signature.parameters includes `{name: "orderId", type: "string", description: "The order ID"}`
- Given DomainOp, When `--return-type void`, Then signature.returnType is `"void"`
- Given multiple `--parameter` flags, When command run, Then all parameters added to signature.parameters array
- Given parameter format missing type (just `"orderId"`), When command run, Then validation error
- Given empty parameter name (`":string"`), When command run, Then validation error

### Dependencies
- None (schema and builder already support signatures)

### Related Code
- `packages/riviere-cli/src/commands/builder/enrich.ts` — add new options and parsing
- `packages/riviere-cli/src/commands/builder/enrich.spec.ts` — add tests
- `packages/riviere-builder/src/builder-components.spec.ts:222` — example of signature in tests

### Verification
```bash
nx test riviere-cli -- --testNamePattern "enrich.*signature"
```

tasks.title: Reject duplicate values in builder enrich operations
tasks.description: Prevent duplicate entries when enriching components with state changes, business rules, and behavior
tasks.details:
## Deliverable: Builder library rejects duplicate enrichment values

### Context
The enrich command is intentionally additive (documented in step-5-enrich.md and CLI reference). However, when the same value is added twice, duplicates accumulate:

```json
"stateChanges": [
  { "from": "Draft", "to": "Placed" },
  { "from": "Draft", "to": "Placed" }  // duplicate
]
```

The builder library should silently skip values that already exist.

### Key Decisions and Principles
- Skip duplicates silently (no error, no warning) - additive semantics remain
- Compare by value equality, not reference
- Apply to all enrichment arrays: stateChanges, businessRules, behavior.reads/validates/modifies/emits

### Delivers
Running `enrich` multiple times with the same values produces no duplicates.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Given component with stateChange Draft:Placed, When enrich called with Draft:Placed again, Then stateChanges array still has only one entry
- Given component with businessRule "X", When enrich called with "X" again, Then businessRules array still has only one entry
- Given component with reads "this.state", When enrich called with "this.state" again, Then behavior.reads still has only one entry
- Given component with no enrichment, When enrich called with values, Then values are added normally
- Given component with some values, When enrich called with mix of existing and new, Then only new values are added

### Dependencies
- None

### Related Code
- `packages/riviere-builder/src/builder.ts` — enrich method, around line 386
- `packages/riviere-builder/src/builder.spec.ts` — add tests for duplicate rejection

### Verification
```bash
nx test riviere-builder -- --testNamePattern "enrich.*duplicate"
```
